0.00.text:
Translator: Marta Palacio
Reviewer: Denise RQ

10.13.text: Hi everyone, my name is Praya Lundberg.

12.76.text:
I'm an actress and model
in Thailand; that's what I do.

17.45.text:
I struggle with introducing
my occupation to people.

21.41.text: I like to watch people's reactions.

23.59.text:
I either get a weird smirk,
or I can tell they're thinking,

30.19.text:
Especially abroad,
people don't know who I am,

32.37.text:
they're like, "Seriously?
Are you paying your bills OK?"

36.75.text:
But when I was at NIST,
my name was actually Nataya Lundberg

41.62.text:
I'm the girl with the hair
covering my face.

43.84.text:
I have no idea why I chose that hairstyle
for my yearbook photo.

48.10.text:
Thankfully, I dress
a little bit better now.

50.88.text:
My experience at NIST was
a little bit different to everyone else's

54.52.text: that's why I'd like to share it.

56.06.text:
I can tell you that most of you in here
don't realize how fortunate you are

59.65.text: to be able to receive an education

62.08.text:
that is not only a quality
and professionally-organized education,

66.78.text:
but also a beautiful,
multinational, multicultural education.

73.96.text:
Just look around us:
how many nationalities do you see?

77.17.text:
How many languages
do we speak between us?

80.33.text:
We are taught not only to embrace this
naturally but to grow from it.

84.72.text:
Prevailing global issues such as racism,
we would never even understand.

89.65.text: I think that's a beautiful thing.

91.60.text:
That's something you all have to keep
with you for the rest of your life.

97.26.text:
My time at NIST was not
the easiest time, I have to admit,

100.38.text:
and me coming up here to talk about it
isn't the easiest thing for me.

104.26.text:
I started acting and modeling
at the age of 14, in year 8.

108.66.text:
I was spotted at a mall on Sukhumvit
and signed my contract two months after.

114.23.text:
My parents had no idea
what would transpire

117.63.text:
But they were supportive
of my career path and my education.

120.95.text:
My typical day at school
would be waking up at 6 a.m.,

125.66.text:
going through the IB, going to class,
finishing class at 3, and then afterwards,

130.54.text:
going straight to a film set
working from 12 to 1.

133.36.text:
I worked on weekends,
I worked on school holidays.

136.26.text:
High-school was lonely for me.
It stressed me out a lot.

139.31.text: I was envious of my friends.

141.64.text:
I wished I could do things
without being in the spotlight,

144.47.text:
making mistakes
like normal teenagers could.

149.45.text:
I couldn't be more thankful
for that opportunity

152.68.text:
because it taught me to exercise
strong self-discipline

157.05.text: With my job, if I don't show up on set

159.05.text:
not only do I let down 200 people,
nothing happens!

162.33.text:
There would be huge
financial consequences,

164.43.text: no one can substitute for me.

165.88.text:
If I'm sick, they have a saying in my job,
"Unless you're dead, you better show up.

170.63.text:
Trust me, I've had an IV taken
out of my hand

174.80.text: and dragged back on set when I was dying.

177.82.text: Yeah, the cons of my job.

180.00.text:
But I'd like to say
that NIST was so supportive.

184.54.text:
That's a great thing
about being in this as a student.

190.20.text:
they make sure
that you can achieve your dream

192.51.text:
and at the same time,
get a great education.

195.58.text:
After that, my parents
sent me to university in the UK,

198.29.text:
and I was able to study
without the pressures of having to work,

202.75.text:
without having to think
about being an adult anymore.

207.15.text: I was able to learn and grow.

209.67.text:
For some of you,
that's happening really soon,

211.96.text:
so I just want to say:
enjoy your college years.

214.50.text:
They're the best years of your life.
I promise you that.

219.91.text:
I changed my negative emotions
about my job to positive ones.

226.17.text:
that when you do what you love,
and you have gratitude,

228.92.text: you achieve so much more with your life.

231.74.text:
Whatever you're doing,
try to make it a positive experience,

236.12.text: even if it's hard right now.

237.52.text:
even if you're doing your IB exam soon,
and you think, "God, it's hard."

242.03.text:
Make it a positive thing,
and you'll do so well.

245.19.text:
Recently, I went to a temple
with my manager, in Lopburi.

250.81.text:
It is a Buddhist temple
that takes care of AIDS patients.

253.84.text:
We were visiting temples within the area,
and I decided to go to this one.

259.71.text: When I say small, I mean nothing special.

265.13.text: They took me to the terminally ill ward.

267.92.text:
As I approached the third patient
lying in his bed;

276.75.text:
I don't think he's moved
in a very long time.

279.68.text:
He can't pick up a spoon when he's hungry,
go to the bathroom when he needs it,

285.26.text:
or even take a walk on a nice sunny day;
things that we take for granted daily.

290.23.text:
When I was walking up to him,
I felt a sense of fear,

294.98.text: I've never had that kind of fear.

297.58.text:
As my hand touched his hand,
I said in Thai,

302.17.text: "I'm sorry for disturbing your rest time."

305.11.text:
He looked back at me
with so much generosity, and said,

310.77.text: "No, your smile has made my day."

315.85.text: I held back my tears because I thought,

319.52.text:
"God, everything that I looked
and reflected in my life

323.90.text:
that I thought was so important,
all comes down to nothing."

327.49.text: In a split second, he changed my life.

335.03.text: I think from that moment onwards,

337.88.text:
my goal and purpose
in life should be different.

341.29.text:
We should not only
just chase success, chase money.

345.44.text:
That's what I do, but I think life -
there's so much more to it.

349.04.text:
I think giving back to the community
is something that we should all do.

354.44.text:
It doesn't have to be about money,
it doesn't have to be something big,

359.49.text:
even doing something nice
to your neighbor.

361.81.text:
I'm not here to tell you I'm perfect;
I'm not a saint, trust me.

365.02.text:
If you'd seen the Thai tabloids,
you'd know.

367.67.text:
I've done so many things
in my life I'm not proud of

374.21.text:
and the thing about being human
is that you have the ability

378.28.text:
to learn, grow, and reflect
from your mistakes.

384.44.text:
that every day you have the choice
to be compassionate,

387.43.text:
to be kind to yourself
and everyone else around you.

390.09.text:
I would tell you that from today onwards,
someone is going to do something to you

394.02.text:
that will hurt you,
that will disappoint you;

396.13.text:
someone will embarrass you;
it's happened to me a million times.

399.19.text:
But don't let that harden you,
let it soften you.

403.20.text:
Let it open your heart up
and change you for the better

405.84.text:
so that you can be the change
that you wish to see in the world.

410.15.text:
I'm going to leave you
with a quick end note

412.30.text: from one of my favorite books.

413.75.text: I didn't read this book in high-school,

415.63.text:
I picked it up at the airport
a couple of years back.

418.38.text:
I picked it up because it was
on the best-seller list,

421.19.text: and it was the smallest one.

422.63.text: So I said, "That's the one I'm going for."

425.61.text:
It's called "Tuesdays with Morrie"
by Mitch Albom.

428.35.text:
It's about a guy who goes back
and sees his sociology teacher,

432.57.text: who was terminally ill with ALS.

435.18.text:
They have discussions
about love, money, and regrets.

439.68.text:
"So many people walk around
with a meaningless life.

444.76.text:
even when they are busy
doing things they think are important.

447.80.text:
This is because they are chasing
the wrong things.

450.17.text:
The way you get meaning into your life
is to devote yourself to loving others,

454.67.text:
devote yourself
to your community around you,

457.71.text:
and devote yourself to creating something
that gives you purpose."

460.93.text: I couldn't agree with it more.

462.58.text:
I've been working for 12 years,
I still don't know what I want,

465.64.text:
but I know that I feel happiest
when I have a purpose.

470.32.text:
This is the first time I've come up
and shared a personal experience.

474.14.text:
You don't do that often with my job,
you're taught to have a wall.

477.39.text:
I'd like to say the thing
that makes me happiest

481.65.text:
is that of all the years I've worked,
and all the exciting years to come,

487.30.text:
I have a voice to share my thoughts,
my visions, my passions,

491.71.text:
and hopefully, make
a positive change in the world.

494.88.text:
I'd like to say that I don't know
where you all will end up in life,

498.43.text: but I hope that you find your voice,

500.46.text:
and you make your voice powerful,
you make it strong,

504.53.text:
but at the same time,
you make it kind, you make it gentle.

508.56.text:
You have a voice
with the intention to listen.

511.45.text: Let your voice change the world.
